meanings.definition: Relating to the perception or awareness of the position and movement of one's own body.
meanings.sent1: She had a proprioceptive understanding of where her arms were even with her eyes closed.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's proprioceptive skills allowed her to move gracefully and confidently.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's proprioceptive powers helped him navigate through the dark tunnel without bumping into anything.
meanings.sent4: His proprioceptive sense was so sharp that he could feel the slightest shift in his body position.
meanings.sent5: The proprioceptive nature of cats is evident in their ability to always land on their feet.

meanings.definition: The ability to sense the position, location, orientation, and movement of the body and its parts.
meanings.sent1: His proprioceptive sense helped him maintain balance while walking on the narrow beam.
meanings.sent2: Athletes rely on their proprioceptive abilities to perform complex movements with precision.
meanings.sent3: The robot's advanced proprioceptive system allowed it to avoid obstacles effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: In a crowded room, her proprioceptive sense guided her to navigate through the crowd without collisions.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's impeccable proprioceptive sense was admired by all who watched her perform.
